Uses of Class
checkmate.logic.game.Square

  • Packages that use Square 
    Package Description
    checkmate.logic.game
    Classes in this package contain the game logic.
    checkmate.logic.pieces
    This package contains classes for chess pieces.

      Checks the list given as parameter, if any of the moves would cause check.
      ArrayList<Square> CastlingAndCheck.possibleCastlingSquares(Piece king)
      Checks whether player has available rooks on the board and if player's king is in its initial position, then returns a list of squares the player can castle their king.
      ArrayList<Square> Validator.setOccupiedSquares()
      Checks which of the squares are occupied.
      ArrayList<Square> Validator.validMoves(Piece p)
      Checks every square on board whether p can be moved to it according to chess rules.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Checks if Square s is located diagonally from this.

      Checks whether Square s is in the same file (line vertically) as this.

      Checks if Square s is in the same rank (line horizontally) as this.

      Checks whether the move of piece p to square to is valid.
      boolean Validator.piecesBetween(Square from, Square to)
      Checks whether there are any pieces between squares to and from.

      Checks whether there are any pieces between squares to and from vertically.
      boolean CastlingAndCheck.tryMove(Piece p, Square s)
      Checks whether moving a player's piece to a square would cause that player to become checked.
      void ChessGame.turn(Piece p, Square s)
      Checks whether the players still have valid moves, then executes the player's move.

      Constructors in checkmate.logic.pieces with parameters of type Square 
      Constructor and Description
      Bishop(Square s, String c)
      Calls constructor of parent class Piece.
      King(Square s, String c)
      Calls constructor of parent class Piece.
      Knight(Square s, String c)
      Calls constructor of parent class Piece and sets this.type to "knight".
      Pawn(Square s, String c)
      Calls constructor of parent class Piece, sets initSquare to s and sets direction based on colour to 1 or -1, for whites and blacks, respectively.
      Piece(Square s, String c)
      Constructor sets this.square to s, this.colour to c, this.type to "" and this.available to boolean.
      Queen(Square s, String c)
      Calls constructor of parent class Piece.
      Rook(Square s, String c)
      Calls constructor of parent class Piece.
